reviews.text: We have just spent a weekend in Nuremberg for the Christmas market opening ceremony. Absolutely delighted with the hotel's friendly staff and the rooms are spacious (double with kitchenette) and excellent value. Having spent fortunes on "4 star" hotels in France we were delighted with the superior quality of this 3 star hotel. The breakfast room was relaxed, service attentive and we were given plenty of options for a hearty 5 course (my preference, ahem!) start to the day.
reviews.title: Excellent value

likes.liked: — Facilities in rooms and breakfast service
likes.disliked: — Bedroom space was very hot at night

reviews.text: The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the main market square but you are quickly within the old town walls and able to stroll Nuremberg's picturesque streets.
reviews.title: Find another spot
Christmas Markets
reviews.text: In the evening the hotel was exceptionally popular for both meals and drinks in the ground floor restaurant/bar area which was very affordably priced. Nuremberg is a wonderful destination for the Christmas market and the atmoshere (like the locals) is genuinely friendly. Superb value and a great start to the Chritsmas season!

When I first walked into the hotel room, I thought "Wow, tripadvisor rocks. This is great!" I expected to give it 5 stars because of the stove, the microwave, the free beer, the patio, and the nice breakfast. If I was only a budget traveller I might have been happier, but I was in town for a conference and the problems the hotel had could be disasterous for someone trying to conduct business. Here they are:

likes.liked: — refrigerator, stove, microwave, patio, comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — major technical problems with internet that they did not fix, they lose reservations
